        Specified by:
        getSteamProfile in interface LeaderboardService
        Parameters:
        SteamID64 - Any string, hopefully it is that of a user from the Steam system which also has friends in my system.
        Returns:
        Collection of SteamProfile objects creates for the provided parameter user and their friends.

      • completeSteamProfile

        @Async
private java.util.concurrent.CompletableFuture<SteamProfile> completeSteamProfile​(java.lang.String playerData)
                                                                           throws java.lang.InterruptedException
        This method contains every processing piece to parse an ass load of data from Steam. Look at the other methods to get an idea for how much data this pulls together to deliver a result to the controller. This method contains a lot of tests to ensure that if any data is missing it will just not be noticed to the end user, however if you have console access you might be able to read some of the text there. TODO Eventually this method should be able to parse data in an async manner to not bog down to processing line.
        Parameters:
        playerData -
        Returns:
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException
        Since:
        2.5

      • getUserFriends

        private java.util.Optional<java.util.List<FriendID>> getUserFriends​(java.lang.String SteamID64)

      • compileUserSearch

        public java.util.List<FriendID> compileUserSearch​(java.lang.String steamID64)
        Using a user in the Steam system you can create an array of their friends from our databases. More to this however! The return will include the root user provided because it is considered a 'master' user list.
        Parameters:
        steamID64 - user from Steam
        Returns:
        master user list

      • saveGames

private void saveGames​(java.util.List<Game> gameList)
        This method will take a list of games which will then create a new threaded process to manage the check and saving of all the games.

      • getRequest

        private net.minidev.json.JSONObject getRequest​(java.lang.String getURL)
        This is a helper method, in this method you can provide a String of the URL for requesting and it will return a JSONObject of the response from Steam.
        Parameters:
        getURL - Pass in a String of the API request URL.
        Returns:
        A json-smart object of the
        Since:
        1.0

      • getSteamEndpoint

        private net.minidev.json.JSONObject getSteamEndpoint​(java.lang.String endpoint,
                                                     java.lang.String steamID64)
        This helper method is specific for a URL that required the extension of steamID onto it, suppling the appropriate data will append '&steamid=' and the supplied steamid to the string. After this small modification to the endpoint it will reach out to the endpoint using getRequest() and return the JSONObject of data
        Parameters:
        endpoint - The steam endpoint to modify, one of the variables in this class
        steamID64 - A string of 17-digit length
        Returns:
        The JSON data in a proprietary data format
        Since:
        1.0

      • populateSecurityKey

        private void populateSecurityKey()
        This method is void but should always be run at least once per public interface call

        public void setAPIKey​(java.lang.String key)
        This method was created for the jUnit tests, there is a bug with loading the @Value spring annotation and reading the api key from application.properties
        Parameters:
        key - the API key
        Since:
        1.5
